III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12405 Change in Placement
Section (i) That the current foster parent was notified in writing of
Description the following information:
(i) Not less than 14 calendar days in advance, of the
change, except when prior notification would jeopardize
the child’s care or safety. If prior notice is not provided,
then the agency shall notify the foster parent, at the time
of the change, why prior notice was not given.
1

(ii) Of the current foster parent’s rights concerning the
change in placement.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster Parent was not provided required notification.
Investigation It was alleged the foster parents of Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C
were not given notification by the agency of a change in
placement for the foster children.
Interviews:
I interviewed Complainant 1 and Complainant 2 by telephone on
10/18/2023. They reported the foster children had been placed in
their home since May 2022. They stated they were given notice
by the agency that the children were to be moved effective
8/14/2023. This was confirmed with a DHS 30 document that was
signed 8/1/2023. They stated they appealed the decision to the
Foster Care Review Board. The Foster Care Review Board
decision supported the agency's intent to move the children to
another foster home. Complainant 1 and Complainant 2 reported
they were a borrowed bed/home for the placement of these
children. They reported they had a good working relationship with
their certifying agency, but they had communication issues with
the placing agency. Complainant 1 and Complainant 2 stated the
children had medical needs that they did not think other
placements could meet.
I interviewed Foster Care Worker 1 by telephone on 12/6/2023.
Foster Care Worker 1 reported the children were doing well in
their new placement. Foster Care Worker 1 indicated the new
placement is able to meet the medical needs of the children. The
worker reported the complainants were notified as confirmed by
documentation and the Foster Care Review Board findings.
Documentation Reviewed:
I reviewed placement information for Youth A, Youth B, and Youth
C in the MISACWIS information system. Documentation for the
identified change in placement included the completion of a DHHS
30 notifying the foster parents of the change in placement to be
effective 8/14/2023. The foster parent confirmed receipt of the
notification as they appealed to the Foster Care Review Board.
This notification was signed by the worker, supervisor, and foster
parent 8/1/2023. The foster parents appealed this decision to the
Foster Care Review Board. The Foster Care Review Board
Hearing occurred 8/11/2023. The Foster Care Review Board
2

findings dated 8/16/2023 supported the change in placement by
the agency. The change in placement occurred effective
9/15/2023. The agency received permission/approval for the
change in placement from MCI 9/6/2023. The children were
subsequently moved 9/15/2023 and the documentation for this
move included the DHS 69, Foster Care/Juvenile Justice Action
Summary forms for each child that were completed 9/14/2023.
Additional documentation included Family Team Meetings (FTM’s)
that were completed 8/22/2023 and 11/20/2023. FTM
documentation included Family Team Meeting Activity Report
(DHS- 1105) that indicated participants in the FTM meetings
included the foster parents, representatives from the certifying
agency of the foster parents, representatives from the agency
providing supervision, representatives from adoption services, the
LGAL of the children, and CASA representatives. Part of the
purpose of this FTM was to address change in placement issues.
Analysis The findings of this investigation determined the agency did
provide the necessary notification to the foster parents to facilitate
the move to another foster home placement.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
